definition: to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
harsh and unreasonable/unexpected

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
variant of 霸[ba4]
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: There is no law and order and motorcycle gangs terrorize the country.
sentences.chinese: 世间没有法律和秩序，只有飞车党横行霸道。

sentences.english: The more the reactionaries lash out, the more resistance they provoke.
sentences.chinese: 越是横行霸道，就越发激起更强烈的反抗。

sentences.english: The street was overrun by the bullies last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年那些暴徒在街上横行霸道，无恶不作。

sentences.english: The Fascists once tyrannized a large part of the world.
sentences.chinese: 法西斯曾在世界很大范围内横行霸道。

sentences.english: During the Second World War, China had been overrun by Japanese invaders.
sentences.chinese: 二战期间，日本侵略者在中国横行霸道，无恶不作。

sentences.english: For many hundreds of years, the armies of the Dark Gods had ruled triumphant over the realms.
sentences.chinese: 数百年来，黑暗之神的军队一直在诸域横行霸道。

definition: tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
to go on the rampage/to riot/to run amuck
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
to oppress the people/to act tyrannically
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
rampant/unbridled/arrogant/aggressive
to stir up trouble
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
to bully/to push around
